note.p: Education: Winchester College; Trinity College, Cambridge

Career: Suffered from parozysmal tachycardia, so unable to serve in World War I and advised against career in medicine; Fellow of Trinity College, Cambridge (1923); Lecturer in Biochemistry, Cambridge (1923-1927); University Lecturer in Physiology, Cambridge (1927-1947); Rockefeller travelling Fellow, USA (1929); research on the effects of carbon monoxide, Harvard Fatigue Laboratory (1940); returned to Cambridge (end of World War II); John Humphrey Plummer Professor of Colloidal Science, Cambridge (1947-1967); Head, Department of Colloidal Science
AssocMaterial: NCUACS 88/1/00. Papers deposited in Cambridge University Library
Obituaries: Biographical Memoirs of Fellows of the Royal Society 1973 vol 19 pp 563-582, plate, by Q H Gibson
